alert.note: Alert for Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 20 at 4:11AM EST until January 21 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 below zero. * WHERE...Western Greenbrier County. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures are forecast to drop to as low as the single digits above zero overnight and early Friday along with northwest winds gusting up to 15 to 25 mph at times.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory is issued when strong winds will combine with cold temperatures for several hours to create dangerously cold conditions for exposed skin. Use caution while outside. Wear appropriate clothing, several layers of clothing is preferable, along with a hat, ear muffs, and gloves.
